messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-IsNiceParts custom node?
The ComfyUI-IsNiceParts custom node detects body parts (currently only hands) and skeletons from the received image, and outputs True if it is a good part.
What are the two installation methods for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts?
The two installation methods for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts are using ComfyUI Manager or using git clone.
Where should the model files for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts be stored?
The model files for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts should be stored in the 'models' folder within the ComfyUI-IsNiceParts directory.
What are the three model files required for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts?
The three model files required for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts are hand_yolov8n.pt, dw-ll_ucoco_384.onnx, and yolox_l.onnx.
How can you add the ComfyUI-IsNiceParts node in ComfyUI?
To add the ComfyUI-IsNiceParts node in ComfyUI, go to Add Node > IsNiceParts > NiceHand.
What is the purpose of the 'confidence' parameter in ComfyUI-IsNiceParts?

The 'confidence' parameter in ComfyUI-IsNiceParts is used to set the boundary value for judging whether a hand is good or not. It ranges from 0 to 1, with higher values being stricter. The default value is 0.9.
What is the output of the ComfyUI-IsNiceParts node?
The output of the ComfyUI-IsNiceParts node is a boolean value. If the hand is good, it outputs True; otherwise, it outputs False.
Who is the author of ComfyUI-IsNiceParts?
The author of ComfyUI-IsNiceParts is aburahamu.
What is the license for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts?
The license for ComfyUI-IsNiceParts is AGPL-3.0.
